intro: Rapanea rockii, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. The bark and leaves of Rapanea rockii contain compounds that have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
